etymology.description: 凯(凱) ‘triumphant’ + 里 ‘village/ward’ = auspicious phonetic rendering of a local place name.
etymology.interpretation: Primarily a sound-based transcription of a regional/ethnic toponym, with 凯 adding a positive, triumphant nuance and 里 evoking a settlement/locality. Common pattern in Chinese place names to pair an auspicious graph with a toponymic suffix.
etymology.simplification: 凱 → 凯 to reduce strokes; 里 unchanged. The place name otherwise stayed the same in meaning and pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 凯里市在贵州省黔东南州(凱里市在貴州省黔東南州)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎilǐ Shì zài Guìzhōu Shěng Qiándōngnán Zhōu.
examples.english: Kaili City is in Qiandongnan Prefecture, Guizhou Province.

examples.chinese: 我打算去凯里旅行(我打算去凱里旅行)。
examples.english: I plan to travel to Kaili.

examples.chinese: 夏天(夏天)，凯里常下雨(凱里常下雨)。
examples.english: In summer, it often rains in Kaili.
